docs.lead_paragraph: A final House vote this Thursday amounts to a Republican bet that voters will reward the party for its tough-love priorities on spending.

headline.main: House Bill Offers Aid Cuts to Save Military Spending
headline.print_headline: House Bill Offers Aid Cuts To Save Military Spending

docs.abstract: Republican-led House will lay bare the choice between social programs and Pentagon spending when it votes on budget legislation to slice $261 billion from social service programs over the next decade to stave off more than $50 billion in military spending cuts scheduled to take effect in 2013.
docs.snippet: A final House vote this Thursday amounts to a Republican bet that voters will reward the party for its tough-love priorities on spending.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: This is inspired by a classic dish from Apulia, the heel of the Italian boot. The authentic dish is a warm purée of skinned dried fava beans, served with cooked greens, usually chicory, a bitter green that is in the same family as escarole. If you are getting big heads of escarole or another hearty bitter lettuce called Batavia in your C.S.A. baskets, use the tough outer leaves for this and save the tender hearts for salads. 1 pound dried cannellini beans, washed and picked over, soaked for 4 to 6 hours in 2 quarts water and drained
docs.snippet: Puréed fava beans and cooked chicory are a classic pairing in Italy; for this version, almost any kind of hearty bitter lettuce will work.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new study has found that consumption of omega-3 fatty acids, plentiful in fish and nuts, is associated with lower blood levels of beta-amyloid protein. Amyloid plaques and tangles in the brain are characteristic of Alzheimer's disease and are known to increase the risk for mental decline; blood levels of the protein may reflect levels of its deposits in the brain. Researchers studied 1,219 mentally healthy people over 65, recording their diet over one and a half years and testing their blood for beta-amyloid and for vitamins and other nutrients. The study appeared online last week in Neurology.

headline.main: Vital Signs: Nutrition: More Omega-3, Less of a Suspect Protein

docs.abstract: Dr Nikolaos Scarmeas study in journal Neurology finds that the consumption of omega-3 fatty acids is associated with lower blood levels of beta-amyloid protein, substance that has been linked to mental decline and Alzheimer's disease. (M)i

docs.lead_paragraph: Green mole is one of the best destinations I can think of for the tough outer leaves from a head of romaine or leaf lettuce. If you don't eat meat, you can make the mole with vegetable broth and enjoy it over rice and vegetables. For the chicken and stock:
